Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Breakfast & staff wonderful - This IS the place to be folks”
Reviews.Author: Rocknroll22
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a nice 4 day break in a hotel where we didnt have to walk too far to get anywhere interesting and having read a few of the reviews you are now reading, we were impressed with what others had written and i made the booking accordingly. I can genuinly say that everything nice you read, as i read, is actually spot on, (the only downside, which i had read prior to us going) was to ask for a room at the front, as they are more spacious, but we had a choice of a front view with twin beds or another room with no view with a double bed, and as we wanted to be a lil romantic, we chose the latter and a double bed without the view is what we got. So all in all very pleased, although the room was only 4mtrs by 3 mtrs, it was on the small side and a lil cramped, but hey! that was our choice, As others have said, you wont need a taxi ( from airport to hotel is 45 euro each way) the breakfast was superb, the location and staff were wonderful,very peaceful, no drunken idiots shouting outside,just the sound of peace and birds( the feathered variety!!) Just 10 mins walk to shops or a gentle 20min walk to red light district. Would we stay again -YES, but next time we would ask for a more spacious room at the front, as others have said, So go go go, and enjoy your stay as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SLK_Student
Reviews.Content: This place was our saviour. We were abandoning an awful hostel and just walked into Singel Hotel and asked if they had a room. The staff was very friendly, very accomodating, and helpful with directions and reccomendations! The rooms and whole hotel are very clean and comfortable. There is free wifi and also a free computer in the common room. Free breakfast is awesome with your choice of bread, meats, hard boiled eggs, cereal, and juices. It's in an excellent location with beautiful canal views but is not so close to the center that you get stuck with noise. We stayed in a street side room so you could hear the people outside but everyone in Amsterdam is basically in bed early so it isn't a problem. The only thing we didn't like was the fact that the shower doesn't have a door; it's one of those open to the bathroom showers with just a small piece of glass wall near the shower head so the bathroom gets kind of wet but they give you plenty of towels so if you just put one on the floor it's fine. All in all we loved our stay and when we had to move hotels we were sad to go. A great place for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: cindyfan
Reviews.Content: Friendly welcoming staff, great breakfast. Great location, I always stay here when in Amsterdam. Beautiful location on the Singel canal.

Reviews.Title: “1st Taste of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Sarwar O Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was our 1st stay in Amsterdam. Singel Hotel is central and on beautiful canal. The staff were friendly and gave a warm greeting. We discovered an amazing non tourist gift store called Saskia, it's named after the owner who makes the traditional aprons and has great knowledge of local art. The choice of food is great and we didcovered an amazing Cafe called Latei near Neumarket which is small but has amazing tretro deco and very friendly cat. The staff are amazing & warm. I recommend the Coffee and Apple cake. Best to check the weather it was sunny but a chilling cold kept it sharp.

Reviews.Title: “convenient/reasonably priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: BBQPhil
Reviews.Content: Singel Hotel is conveniently located near Central station. There is no need to go by cab, just walk out of Central station cross the canal turn right, go to next canal 2/3 blocks turn left and walk about 4 blocks it is on the left hand side of street. Staff is very courteous and helpful.Continental breakfast is typical European, flat screen TV,

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Sarah H Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed staying at the Singel. Location is perfect, rooms are clean and nicely decorated, breakfast is good and service is great. The only aspect to improve would be tea and coffee making facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Qaulity”
Reviews.Author: jumbone_10 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I would highly recomend the singel hotel , nice clean rooms really helpfull staff and the location is good you cant go wrong here .

Reviews.Title: “Just what you need for a short stay!”
Reviews.Author: topguyspb
Reviews.Content: Pros: - convenient location near the Central Station in the city center - nice continental breakfast - clean rooms Cons: - view from the window to a wall of next building - very slow elevator :) Would definitely recommend the hotel for a short stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: Les Y Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed with my brother and cousin at this hotel and we reserved for a triple room.. we got a very spacious corner room facing the canals. We had a very lovely stay at this hotel, the location was good, just 5mins away from Amsterdam Station and just far enough from the night scenes that it is quiet at night for you to get a restful sleep. All the tourist attractions are within accessibility. The front desk personnel spoke perfect English and was very helpful and nice. Great hotel and great value for your money!

Reviews.Title: “Singel hotel, Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Gill P
Reviews.Content: Was very happy to return to this friendly hotel. The hotel is small,basic and spotlessly clean. The staff always seem genuinely pleased to see you and are extremely helpful. The rooms are small but perfectly adequate. With its central location, the Singel makes an ideal base to explore Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Grat Loaction and value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: 1- It is a great location and clean rooms. The bed was comfortable. however, some services is not itroduced as iron press. The breakfast was delecious. Room Tip: Ask for the room with a view over the Singel canal

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: crislondon08
Reviews.Content: The location is very good being close to Central station and Dam Square, and the hotel is very nice, very clean and reception very helpful. We had a room with a wonderful view over Singel Canal,not too big for a triple but rooms are always small. Bathroom tiny with open shower so you need flip flop. Breakfast was gorgeous with such a variety of food and the buffet was always full. Good quality/price, I cannot understand what people writing bad reviews, were looking for.Overall I can say it's the perfect solution in Amsterdam!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel for a weekend stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: NadushaK
Reviews.Content: A pretty nice hotel right in the centre of the city, 5 min of walking distance from all the main attractions. A nice situation right on one of the canals of Amsterdam. Simple, but nice rooms with everything needed, pretty clean with the windows facing the canal. Not very noisy. Average breakfasts, but always with fresh coffee. Guys (staff) from the night shift were much more friendly and polite than girls during the day. Moreover, they had old information on the reception and old discounts (from the last year) to museums, which we couldn't use. But all in all it's nice normal and cheap hotel for a stay of not more than 1 weekened in this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gillian M
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried because of some of the comments from reviewers but took a chance anyway because rooms were going fast the week we went. My main priority was to have somewhere close to Centraal station because our flight came in at 20.40 and I didn't want any complex transfers. Singel hotel is literally up the road and round the corner from the main station so was perfect. But even though it was close to the station the street was actually relatively quiet - most of the noise came from bikes clattering past. We had room 25 which is a double (although it was actually twin beds pushed together) and looks right out onto the canal. Yes the room was small but this seems to be a feature of Amsterdam architecture rather than the hotel being mean with space. Look at the buildings in Amsterdam - they are TINY. The staff were all pleasant, polite and helpful. The desk is open 24hours which is a boon when you have no idea when you will return.....The TV selection is not bad - for english speakers there was BBC 1,2,3, CBBC and some generic US channels. Unfortunately the reception was a bit patchy at times meaning all the channels were not available. The hotel has a lift and contrary to what a previous reviewer said - it worked well :) I would book this hotel again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not too impressive staying”
Reviews.Author: Elena G
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to Netherlands, so maybe some things are normal there, but my first impression wasn't too good. My single room was very small, cosy, the room was cleaned every day, but in the bathroom... it was too damp there 'cause of poor work of air-ventilation system I think and it wasn't cleaned at all for all 3 days I stayed there. So on the second day my floor towel was soaked and got yellow and water was everywhere, and I was scared to use hairdryer to stay alive. And water was dropping from the tap when I turned on the heating) So I'd call my staying there "watering season". I didn't feel like in a 3-stars hotel there.

Reviews.Title: “basic but clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: coconut-monkey09
Reviews.Content: good location approx 5-10mins walk to central station. stayed four times in hotel, most recent december 2011. hotel is basic but is clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, Lovely people.”
Reviews.Author: Lauren-and-Tom
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at the hotel, had a fantastic room, the staff were wonderful, again, very helpful and polite and had no problems taking care of our bags before we could check in and after we checked out, so we didn't have to carry our bag round. The cleaning staff make the rooms up perfectly, the location is perfect, close enough to everything to be in the action but in an area that feels private and calm. Good value for money considering all their positive points, would struggle to find a negative. We will always goto this hotel when we goto Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Zaubie
Reviews.Content: After all the mostly positive reviews about this hotel, I suppose I have to say I was pretty disappointed. As always, it's subjective as I was in a room that might be totally different to others, but what I had (Room 22 I think) was TINY. I appreciate that it used to be a Merchants House and it's lots of little rooms, etc, but it doesn't make for a very comfortable stay, especially if you need to spend a little more time in your room than just sleeping. We did have a glimpse of the canal, however, so that was nice, but for two adults, with bags, it was a squeeze. It's also is a slightly seedy part of town - didn't bother us too much, but something for others to consider. It also seemed a bit on the pricey side, and I think with some more research we could have found a bigger, better room for less, although we did hit a weekend with a special event (the marathon) so things were more expensive. Being an old house, it's also a bit noisy internally, so you can hear people chatting, doors slamming, tv's etc. On the plus side, the room was clean, the service was efficient, the breakfast was good, the location handy. One thing that annoyed the hell out of me - as it does in any establishment - is loud piped music in the breakfast room. I am a fan of NO music as it's a time to wake, reflect, chat, work out the day, but if there is anything it should be LOW in volume, and relaxing. NOt so here. One morning it was the radio (complete with announcer, etc) and another morning just loud rock style music.

Reviews.Title: “Wandering wrinkly”
Reviews.Author: Christine K
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights in November prior to embarking on a cruise. The reception staff were efficient, effective and most welcoming. Of cause the interior had it's constraints like most hotels in Europe, but this is what one would expect when wanting to experience the true Dutch ambiance. The continental breakfast was substantial with sufficient fortification for a full day of sightseeing. All areas were clean and well maintained. Even though my single overlooking the canal was extremely small by any standards but it was cozy and adequate. The carpet in some of the common areas were showing signs of staining.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay in Singel Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tiphaine1504
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for 3 nights with a friends. We asked for a twins bed rooms, smoking with a canal view and all was respected. Rooms are tiny but as usual in Amsterdam. Bathroom is the black point of the room, small and not very usefull. Beds are comfortables and the hotel isn't noisy. The street is quite and well located. The breakfeast is good and you can be a bit late, they let you the time to eat quietly. staff speaks english and is smiling. So i will eventually comme again in this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as Advertised”
Reviews.Author: Mandelmart
Reviews.Content: The locations is great because while close to the station and Damrak, etc., it's on the quiet Singel canal. I stayed in the "Smallest single room in Amsterdam" and found it to be just as advertised. And while it seemed expensive for the limited space and amenities, just a little research of Amsterdam hotel prices shows it's a good value. The staff members I encountered were professional, but not overly friendly. The night can be loud...not from outside, but from careless other guests talking loudly and banging doors.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms Friendly staff Good Location”
Reviews.Author: PRJ198
Reviews.Content: Opening the door to our double room, the door hit the end of the bed. So the room was very small. Otherwise for one night it was OK. The staff were very friendly and very helpful. The breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Time to renovate the rooms !”
Reviews.Author: Uz27
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel before, and in the last time I gave 4* to this hotel . But since then, have passed 2.5 years and the condition the hotel became worse :-( The general condition of the hotel is still Ð¾Ðº but the condition of the rooms is worsened - dirty carpets, stains, falling off part of shower , not working radio and a safe and much more ... I hope that the hotel will take note ,and make repairs in the rooms. Positive - free and FAST internet, breakfast and good location.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Iva S
Reviews.Content: Very good location - close to everything yet peaceful at night. The staff is very friendly. Breakfast and room size ABOVE my expectation as the reviews I read before my trip were not very promising; the breakfast choice is more than sufficient with the quality was in place, and the single room I booked could easily fit 2 people. Definitively value for money and worth recommending!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: natasha b
Reviews.Content: I was adamant that I didnt rate this hotel but then got stranded in Dam for an extra night and had to stay in the hans brinker, that was an experience in itself and left me pining for the comfort of the singel. So it was very clean, shower always hot and very comfy bed, but the time was wrong on the tv and clock so missed breakfast but they did provide us with tea although we'd paid for a full breakfast. Also I emailed the hotel and was advised check in was 1pm amsterdam time but on arrival was advised it was at 2pm, it was only an hours difference but after a long time travelling we just wanted to freshen up but they did allow us to leave our luggage whilst they prepared the room and also after we checked out as we had a few hours before we thought we was flying. I really want to point out the location of this place, your 10mins from centraal amsterdam, 5mins from redlight district and 5mins from jordaan so ideal for anyone doing amsterdam on foot. Last point the area of the hotel is really quiet your close to everything but not in the thick of it so it's very peacefull but the walls are very thin you can literally here peoples conversations but in all fairness the hotel did not have anyone lairy.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful experience”
Reviews.Author: Charliefaus
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our visit. We only stayed one night since we were on our way to Rotterdam for a cruise of the Baltic capitals, but the hotel staff was VERY friendly, helpful and went above and beyond what they needed to do to satisfy us 100%. No, 110%! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the city but not the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moti F
Reviews.Content: Nice City, the room was quite ok but the bathroom was really terrible. didnÂ´t have a normal shower just a hole in the ground and a curtain around. Staff was friendly, breakfast was a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MMfromAustin
Reviews.Content: I booked a triple room overlooking the canal. The room was a bit small (person staying in bed closest to window had to climb over other bed as no walking room around) but not too bad. Very little noise from surrounding rooms or outside. Breakfast buffet had the basics. Hotel is very convenient to train station (about 3 blocks) but in a relatively low traffic area.

Reviews.Title: “Never will go back there again.”
Reviews.Author: Jason A
Reviews.Content: I didn't like the attitude of one of the ladies at the front desk. She was kind of rude and made me feel not welcome in Amsterdam. Also I did not like the fact that the shower floor was connected to the rest of the bathroom floor including the toilet. That was odd and didn't seem sanitary. The elevator was extremely slow and felt it could break at any moment.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: simpletireman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Singel Hotel for 3 nights. Originally I had reserved the room online with a credit card, American Express. When I arrived to pay for the room and receive services, the girl at the desk informed me that they do not take the Amex. After talking about it with her, she was very kind about taking my card anyway, and providing the services as originally requested. Other than that minor hiccup, there were no issues with my stay. The hotel staff was friendly, spoke great English when necessary, and the breakfast was also top notch. I would definitely recommend Singel Hotel for anyone to stay in. Also, the quality of the room was higher than nearly all other places I stayed on my 12-city trip across Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Should we keep this a secret, or share the good news”
Reviews.Author: ilc2it
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Singel Hotel with my teenage daughter during July 2011. We caught a train from the airport to Amsterdam Centraal. It was then a short walk to the hotel which was easy to find. The hotel consists of three 17th century buildings and the rooms were compact, but clean and comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful. There were no tea or coffee making facilities in the hotel room. However, the staff at reception were happy to make us a pot of tea which we had in the breakfast area. There was a public computer in the breakfast area and free wi-fi access in the rooms. The hotel is within easy reach of all main attractions. We highly recommend the hotel to others, although perhaps we should keep it a secret so that it is not booked up when we next travel that way!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: emekk
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is great, very close to the central. The room was small but clean.The staff were very friendly and helpful.If u stay at weekend, it's a bit expensive.The breakfast was delicious and there was free Wi-Fi.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful setting.”
Reviews.Author: Moondance29
Reviews.Content: This hotel is walking distance from Centraal Station. It is very basic, but the setting and good breakfast makes up for that. We had a room overlooking the Singel canal and I will definately return. Make sure you get a room with a view.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: misskeika
Reviews.Content: Good location. That is the best and only point. Average cleanliness, tiny rooms with only basic equipment and splendid views of nothing except next building's wall (just about one meter away). Male staff in reception is nice, polite and friendly but the woman gives a very bad impression with her attitude; didn't like her ways at all. Breakfast VERY expensive and below the average. For the price â€¦.. wouldn't recommend it at all. Sure you can find better deals in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Basic, Very Basic!”
Reviews.Author: AliBlk
Reviews.Content: We used this as our base for going to the Assen MotoGP as we had never been to Holland before and wanted to see Amsterdam. The hotel is in an excellent location, very central, with a short walk to the Centraal station, but it is just basic and so noisy! Doors get slammed at all hours and although the hotel says it "has a quiet policy between 21:00 - 07:00" we didn't sleep a wink the first night - I'm sure the only way you could get to sleep is if you were stoned! The second night was better, but only just!! We had a double room (No. 22) and although I had asked for a canal view room when I made the reservation, was told by the rather surly girl on reception upon arrival that none of the double rooms overlooked the canal - only the twin rooms!! We paid 323 euros for 2 nights accommodation which I thought was quite expensive for such a basic hotel. On the plus side, the bed and pillows were comfy and the continental breakfast was okay. However I would never stay at this hotel again. I have to comment on how great the train system is though. Everything was just so simple from arriving at Amsterdam Schipol and getting a train to Amsterdam Centraal station to departing the Centraal station for Assen the following morning. Excellent value for money, couldn't fault it in any way!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - close to the train station”
Reviews.Author: Kimmy130886
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business trip, was easy and quick to find from the station. Foudn hotel staff to be very helpful and friendly. Rooms average for the price really but then again find Amsterdam quite expensive for accommodation. I slept fine but my colleague who got a ground floor room said it was very noisy the whole evening. TIP: try and get something 2-3 floor if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Location doesn't make up for price and tiny room”
Reviews.Author: californianonthemove
Reviews.Content: We booked two nights at the Singel Hotel because its location on one of the most attractive canals was close to the center of the city and the major destinations one would want to visit in Amsterdam. Price of the room was just under $200 US a night. We were in Room 32, and it was ridiculously small, even for a city when hotel rooms do run on the small side. The bed wasn't that big, but it took up more than half the space in the room. Light fixtures are operated by switches just above where one's head rests while sleeping. All too easy to hit switches when one is trying to sleep. Tiny bathroom too. The continental breakfast was good. Staff was personable and helpful. But in the final analysis, this is an overpriced hotel that might suit backpackers who just want a place to sleep for a few hours. For a holiday in Amsterdam, it doesn't add much to the experience.

Reviews.Title: “The smallest room in the city: a nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: francesca61Firenze
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights, read about this fact (The smallest room in amsterdam) on their site but didn't ask for it, not at all! But I was given it, small is too big a word to describe the lack of space, air, oxigen you feel after a couple of minutes you are staying in this room. And I payed 55 euros for the first night and 80 for the second! In my region (Tuscany, Italy) you need to have at least 9 square metres for accommodating a person in a hotel. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: megruhot
Reviews.Content: Checked in to this small hotel to find wonderful clean surroundings and helpful staff. Quiet hotel in the middle of one of the busier areas of Amsterdam. Rooms were small but extremely well planned and brand new.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. I liked it so much I went and stayed again.”
Reviews.Author: JamezP
Reviews.Content: Stay here you will have a great time. Its in a really nice location with wonderful surroundings. I have been twice and have nothing bad to say.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Amsterdam but comes at a cost”
Reviews.Author: Dez_and_AJ
Reviews.Content: It's hard to find good hotel values in Amsterdam where rooms can be notoriously small and prices notoriously high. The Singel tries and I give them credit for that but it doesn't always succeed. Our first floor canal view bedroom was clean, large (for Amsterdam)and decently equipped if decorated in a somewhat non-descript style. The large windows let in a lot of May sunlight and watching the foot, bike and boat traffic going by outside was addictive. However, the bathroom was a totally different story. While clean, it had a distinctly tired and played out green institutional look and feel with blackened tile grout and a stained, speckled linoleum-like floor. The institutional theme at the Singel was also picked up in the page of "guest rules" that one had to sign upon checking in (one rule included a very specific charge of Eur47.25 that would be assessed if you had a guest in your room that stayed longer than two hours). You also had to pay in full upon check in and agree to surrender you room key to the front desk every time you left the hotel. I understand that these rules are in place to control a certain type of "element" from staying at the Singel but overall it makes it seem a bit like checking into a halfway house. But a better hotel probably does cost about another 100 Euros per night and the Singel is in a good location (within easy walking distance of Central Station but still by a relatively quiet canal) and does include a decent breakfast (though service can be chaotic especially when busy). So, the Singel is kind of a compromise. Not sure if we would stay again (but apparently many signers in their guest book loved the place and would).

Reviews.Title: “The only thing it has going for it is its LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: draff0107
Reviews.Content: I was stuck in Amsterdam overnight after missing a flight so I needed somewhere near the station at a reasonable rate and the Singel hotel is exactly that...near the station and reasonably priced. Rooms are pretty small but clean and equipped with ikea type furniture. But it had a feeling of being in a prison cell allbeit a pretty decent one. The hotel lobby and corridors are a little shabby and look like they last saw anything new in the early 1990s. I gave the breakfast a miss but to be honest the breakfast room was less than inviting. All in all I would say avoid unless you are a bit desperate as I was. Oh and maybe being Irish I am a little spolied by the overall quality of our hotels (many build during our boom) but this Dutch three star would struggle and I mean struggle to get a 2 star rating in Dublin....we may have the same currency but we dont have the same hotel rating system- not by any stretch of the imagination.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeanwales
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here and we thought it was a great hotel. The location was ideal, close to the station and the main Dam square. We really appreciated it having an elevator too as we found some of the stairs in Amsterdam just too steep for us. The reception staff were great and indeed everyone we met there was so friendly. Breakfast was fine, the normal continental. Rooms were good. Some say small but this is normal for the city. Good hot water in the shower all the time. My friend had a smoking room on the top floor which she appreciated. Free wifi also a big plus . All in all no negatives at all and I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great front desk if have problem”
Reviews.Author: kasey1945
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money, 8' from Central Station, easy to find, good bfst. Best feature was Jeroem at front desk. BA lost our bags at Heathrow and we were scheduled to board a boat within 36 hours. Most hotels would go out of their way to perhaps provide a phone number. We explained the problem to Jeroen who took ownership. Several calls by him (and others who he directed to follow-up) resulted in a just in time delivery of our luggage direct to the boat dock. His effort alone was worth the price of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Just one warning”
Reviews.Author: Dimitris_VET
Reviews.Content: Just one warning: Don't pay before you see your room. Paying in advance is a bad hotel policy, but DON'T pay until you see your room. Stuff polite but not veru heplfool, breakfast good, location good near the station.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good breakfast, friendly team, good wi-fi Internet connection in the room.”
Reviews.Author: Alexsh_11
Reviews.Content: Good location and good breakfast, friendly team, good wi-fi Internet connection in the room.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: MikeFlis
Reviews.Content: Maybe it's just the magic of the city that makes everyone love their stay, but we had a great time visiting the City and a great stay at this hotel. We arrived before check-in, but this wasn't a problem as the hotel held onto our luggage so we could go start our sight-seeing. The staff at the front desk immediately offered suggestions on sites to see, where we could find restaurants (including a warning of which restaurants were too expensive) and how to get around the City. The room was small, but this wasn't really a problem. Loved that breakfast was included in the price, it was a nice spread of cereals, bread with jam/patÃ©, juice, coffee, tea, etc. Hotel is easy to find and in a great location - walkable to most of the best sites. When I go back, I'll probably stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Half the price but not half the service”
Reviews.Author: kingsleyb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located within 2 mins from Central Station(10mins by train from Schiphol) and only 5 mins from Dam square. Small friendly hotel that offers good value for money. Room was very clean and warm. Staff are friendly and very helpful. Give it a go. I definately will be again.

Reviews.Title: “Singel hotel is a hidden gem just off the beaten path of the pleasant business of the Amsterdam streets.”
Reviews.Author: jefferey33333
Reviews.Content: I had a quaint little room to myself on the top floor. I was able to come and go as I pleased at all hours of the day and night without any hassles or questions. The staff was always very friendly and respectful and answered any questions that I had regarding my stay at the hotel or about the city itself. The breakfast was perfect for someone looking to get a quick bit of energy before starting their early day, but if you are looking for eggs benedict, then there are other places nearby. The location itself was simply perfect! Singel street is not too busy, so you are able to truly relax when retiring to your room, but shopping, nightlife, and the heartbeat of the city is literally just around the corner. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great comfortable stay and not wanting to be in a five-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: tirinini1
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - especially if you re carrying heavy luggage back and to the train station. A Ten min walk to the main train station, buses and trams. While the Singel is very centrally located, it's on a smaller canal side street which has the main advantages of being a lot quieter and a lot nicer than a lot of the surrounding streets that due to their location are loud and sometimes seem a bit dirty. It's actually a beautiful street! I loved the canal view from my room so be sure to ask for a room in the front. I didn't manage to get a smoking room as there is only one smoking floor so be sure to ask in advance if that's available. The rooms are small but I don't think they get any bigger in Amsterdam - in that price range at least.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: Travelz540
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the triple room at this hotel for four nights and it was a great find visiting Amsterdam for the first time. It was very clean and very quant. The staff were friendly and efficient. The breakfast in the morning was the same everyday but it was very good. It couldn't have been in a better location. Within walking distance to Centraal Station, Dam Square, The Red Light District etc. Being this close to all of these places, it was still a quiet location facing the canal. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent and professional”
Reviews.Author: Jerry_L9
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Singel Hotel 3 nights for a congress in town, and I do not regret this. The public transport to the congress centre was nearby, and the dining/relaxing opportunities in the evening were at walking distance. The room was decent, comfortable. I had choosen a room at the back so as to have quieter nights probably compared to the frontside with traffic. But I'm not sure if that was really necessary, as when I walked along the canal at night, it was pretty quiet as well. And Singel Hotel team, thanks for your suggestions concerning the dutch cuisine and restaurant! Didn't know about that, an eye-opener! ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: zeppo2
Reviews.Content: As many others have said, this hotel was located close to the central station, but because it was a few blocks off the Dam it was quiet. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and the morning breakfast a good way to start the day. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location close to Central Station!”
Reviews.Author: mbc701
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a place to stay in Amsterdam for a few days. I had read review after review of canal houses in Amsterdam, but had not been able to decide which one to book with. Originally I had thought about finding a place located between the major museums thinking we could walk to them. But by the time I got around to actually booking, the ones I wanted were already full. I decided to take a chance on the Singel, and we were very happy with it. It was a quick 3 minute walk from Central Station, and that turned out to be the absolute best place for us to be. We took several side trips out of the city on the train, and I realized I would not have been as happy with any other location. Being close to the train station was a definite advantage. The rooms are small, as was expected, and while the decor could use some updating, the rooms were very clean and adequate. We requested the canal view, and that was wonderful. The breakfast bar was great, and the staff was very helpful. The canal houses are not deluxe as would be expected in America, but it was a very charmng little hotel close to a couple of restaurants, and within a very easy walk to The Anne Frank House. The tram stop was also right outside Central Station, and that was an easy way to reach the museums and other attractions. All in all we were very satisfied with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what it says on the tin...”
Reviews.Author: zoe_tron
Reviews.Content: Perfect, couldn't have asked for a better location, we had not travelled to Amsterdam before but we were very lucky with our choice of hotel - RIGHT IN THE HEART OF IT!! The rooms are great with a double bed, desk, flat screen telly and en suite - they're not big by any stretch of the imagination - but they're clean, new and fresh and the temperature is easy to control with a heater and a big window you can get it just right! Breakfast is great, continental style help yourself - hit the spot and kept us going for all of our walking! Would also advise getting the Time Out Guide for the area - found some great gems with that book! Oh and the walking tour (free) by newamsterdam. We're already planning our next trip back (need to hire a bike, do the red light walk and there's a few museums we missed out) the one thing that's certain though is that I'll be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location and a very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: JesslynJames
Reviews.Content: I Had a nice stay in this lovely hotel, the first day, the nice receptionist showed us the nice places to Go in amsterdam, Also she recommend us a very nice restaurant, and the food was very good. the next morning we had a nice breakfast, only when i asked if they had choclate milk, they didn't had......But the next morning the nice lady's made sure the had choclate milk for me (very good service!) The rooms were small, but very comfertable nice beds and a nice view over de canal. We will come back this summer!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, friendly staff, cracking breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: campbell211
Reviews.Content: i've been visiting amsterdam for about 8 years now as my best friend now lives there. i've always stayed with her in the past but the arrival of her new baby meant i wanted to stay in a hotel and not get under her feet. i made the mistake a few trips ago of staying n the hotel (haha!) Ramenas on Haarlemmerdijk, big mistake! unbelievably, it was in the same price range as the singel hotel and it can only be described as a grotty, run down hole. singel hotel has a reception which is manned 24/7, be aware that a lot of the small hotels don't have this. i've stayed in this hotel twice now and the staff are always really friendly and helpful. the rooms are pretty small but every room in these old buildings is small! however, the rooms are really comfortable and clean, they're also serviced daily unless you ask for it not to be. the bathrooms are all white tiled and clean with a decent shower and a hairdryer that;s good enough not to have to take your own. its really central too, about five minutes walk from central station, that's including time taken to dodge the almost permanent roadworks and alterations at the front of central station. breakfast is buffet style with various breads and spreads, fruit, cereals, fruit juices, yougurt, cheeses and cold meats. also the best coffee! if you're a smoker, the rooms on the 4th floor are smoking rooms, the rest of the hotel is smoke free. there is a lift to all floors too...very handy as dutch staircases can be really narrow and steep, coming down is usually more hazardous than going up!! i really give this hotel a big thumbs up. i even got an upgrade on my first visit to a double room. there is some street noise but it is city centre! if you're a light sleeper, take earplugs.....problem solved!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel. Great staff.”
Reviews.Author: bvbeirao
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife had a great time in this hotel. The staff was very helpfull! Nice breakfast. And excellent location! We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I needed”
Reviews.Author: Samskebs
Reviews.Content: The staff were welcoming from the very beginning to the end, even after I had my wallet stolen (with my key card too which I shouldn't have taken it with me), they were understanding and helpful in the situation. The free room safe was a god send in this situation. When booking I requested for a canal view from which I got a quick reply by email. I didnâ€™t have any breakfast there but in terms of everything else, rooms, location and view was spot on for me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Natalya_19
Reviews.Content: I liked staying in this hotel. Very nice location - it's in Singel channel, near to city center, but rather quiet place. Personel was very polite and was ready to give usefull advices about visiting different places of interest. Service and cleanliness of room was good, furniture is also in good condition. My room was small (with bath!), but it wasn't a problem for me as I only slept in the room. Buffet wasn't like a pack with sandwiches with apple :) There was a choise of food and tasty coffee. It seems that there was internet in hall free of charge. The only small minus was that my room was on the ground floor (room â„–8), so it was noisy in the morning (when breakfast was served) and in the late evening, when all guests came home. If you can't sleep when it's not quiet, it's better to ask another room and not near elevator. I think that for me it was optimal combination of quality and price! I'll defenetly reccomend this hotel to my friends!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very helpful and friendly staff,,,,”
Reviews.Author: Pianoman11
Reviews.Content: We received all that we asked for from this hotel, Only thing that could make it a little better would be a refrigerator and coffee/tea making facilities in the room. Just that little extra touch. Otherwise, we would have no problem in staying at the Singel hotel the next time we visit the Dam.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, but ok”
Reviews.Author: RanaBrasil
Reviews.Content: I choose the hotel because it is well located for what I needed and because of the price. I liked the staff, specialy one of them, who gave me informations and where attentious. The room is small, but ok, although I stayed on the triangulo room so I had to be carefull not to hit my head. I felt a pain in my neck, I think the pillow was not good for me.

Reviews.Title: “very disapointed”
Reviews.Author: gypsy026
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel in the past so on this occation when they gave me room 8 I requested another room as I was aware of the noise issue, I was assured by the young lady on reception it would not be a problem however I did explain I was here on business and not pleasure I needed a good nights sleep as I was working the next day, she told me there was no other room available but there would be no issue of noise during the night how untrue this was. I was woken at 1am with load voices around the reception area and I made complaint to no avail after 1 hr I managed to get back to sleep only to be woken again at 4-45am at this point after a heated exchange with the night manager he allowed me to go into a small room on top floor which at least was quite. On my return from my meeting they had moved me into a room 18 which was a lot more suited. The next morning after getting up at 5 am to catch my Taxi to the airport I asked the guy on reception if it would be possible to have a coffee, he refused saying he was too busy? having stayed a number of times in this hotel with early flights this has never been a problem before however the guy who was called peter refused and even after I offered to make it myself he stated this was not allowed. I gave Peter my card with a note on the back requesting the manager to call me when he came on duty so I could speak to him on how disapointed I had been on this visit, Peter assured me that he would pass this on however I am still awaiting that call. In short this was a company paid visit and I could have booked any hotel but because I had stayed here before and indeed recomended this hotel to many friends and colleagues in the past I felt confident that my visit would be OK, I currently doing a lot of business in Holland however I will not use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay in the center of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: kromanovs
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotel located in the very center of Amsterdam, with a view to one of the channels. Central railway station is just in 5-10 minutes walk. The room and bathroom were clean and equipped with everything that is needed for the short stay. Well, probably except for the teakettle :). Continental breakfast, included in the rate, offered coffee/tea, a variety of bread, cheese and ham as well as yogurts, juices, boiled eggs and cakes.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Cozy Smoking Room”
Reviews.Author: tisthehammer
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I enjoyed a romantic 10 day vacation in Amsterdam at the end of December 2010 through the beginning of January 2011. The hotel was a short walk from Central Station. The huge church next door made it very easy to find. We stayed in the double smoking room on the fourth floor. The room was very clean and didn't smell like smoke, despite it being a smoking room. The weather was incredibly cold compared to what we're use to so a smoking room was a nice luxury to have. It was very private and cozy. We had a small room with a view of the church and the Singel canal. The staff was incredible helpful and provided us with decent map and advise on places we should checkout and places we shouldn't waste our time at. The hotel was close enough to walk pretty much everywhere we wanted to go. The breakfast was delicious and was a great way to start off our day. I would stay here anytime I am in the wonderful city of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms and comfy beds, friendly staff, excellent hospitality”
Reviews.Author: mandavanda
Reviews.Content: Total of 4 nights stay. The hotel is about a five minute walk from Central Station, overlooking the Singel canal. It sits just outside the city center, but the neighborhood was quiet and peaceful towards the evening and so we got a great night's sleep each night. Our room was a triple room (room 26, overlooking the canal). Room and bathroom were very clean and we never ran out of towels, toilet paper, etc. Staff was friendly and helpful, and the breakfast offered was lovely. As previously mentioned, close to city center (about a ten minute walk) and also close to Anne Frank House. Overall a very enjoyable stay and great value for price, would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we have stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Lynn186402
Reviews.Content: The service we experienced at this hotel was second to none! Every member of staff was extremely helpful and always cheerful. The rooms were fairly small but extremely clean and always very warm which was great as the weather was really cold in December. The location of the hotel is perfect as a base for sight seeing and surounded by many good restaurants. A very special thanks to the hotel staff for the help we received after a member of our party had their purse (with credit cards) taken from a handbag.

Reviews.Title: “cosy and familiar”
Reviews.Author: woris
Reviews.Content: Smal nice hotel with warm atmosphere right in the centre of the Dutch capital; pleasant stay with all that's worth-to-visit in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Atmospherique, central and cozy hotel with personal and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: omejoop
Reviews.Content: Went for a shopping weekend to Amsterdam and stayed in the Singel Hotel. It were a few very pleasant days and nights. We wanted to know the best hot spots in the city. The friendly staff told us all we wanted to know about the places to be. After a good night rest in the charming room, we had a nice and tasteful breakfast. I highly recommend this hotel to anybody who wants to stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel, and price for your money!”
Reviews.Author: rngogreen
Reviews.Content: My in-laws and I stayed at the Singel Hotel just a few days ago in Amsterdam. This was actually my second time staying at the hotel because my first time staying at the hotel was so nice. It's in a great location: about 5min walk from Central Station and another 5-10min walk to Anne Frank House, and another 10min walk into the Red Light District. The hotel also included a free breakfast, which is always nice to have (meats, cheese, toast and jams, and hard boiled eggs). We also were able to get free tickets for a canal boat cruise with our stay, which is another great savings. Overall I would recommend this hotel for your next stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “So pleased we pick this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: evegoesforth
Reviews.Content: Arriving Monday afternoon at the Central Station we easily found the hotel after a short walk. The de luxe second floor bedroom was a pleasure with a wall of windows giving a marvellous view of the canal. The room had twin beds it was fairly roomy, clean and tidy. All the hotel staff from our first meetings were friendly and very helpful. At the suggestion of the receptionist we pre- booked the Van Gogh Museum on the free internet this saved time queuing the next morning. The holiday experience change on Tuesday evening when my wife had a fall breaking a bone in her foot. After the visit to the hospital we arrived back at the hotel at 4.00 am my wife foot in plaster and on crutches it was then the twenty four reception proved very useful. Next day the receptionist was most helpful organising a wheel chair and giving us details of the trams that had wheel chair access. In the hotel we managed with the wheel chair in the lift, in our bedroom, in the on- suite and at breakfast. We were so pleased that we had picked a hotel with facilities to cope with the situation. We continue our holiday until Friday finding all the people and attractions in Amsterdam helpful and welcoming. I give a big Thank You to the Hotel, to all the staff for being so helpful and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and very conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: Mariner70
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very good place to stay when you want to be in the heart of Amsterdam. Our room was not large, but sufficient. Bathroom OK. Everything perfect clean. We could walk to Anne Frank House, the canals, the Red Light District, etcetera. Staff was very friendly and helpful. All in all, nothing much to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: rikkie1000
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel which represents excellent value for money. The rooms were kept very clean, the bed was comfortable. Breakfast was good and plentiful, The hotel is very close to the Central Station of Amsterdam (very convenient for us) and within walking distance of many tourist attractions. We enjoyed our stay very much and we will certainly be staying with them on our next visit to Amsterdam. We found everyone extremely helpful to us and loved everything about the Singel Hotel !

Reviews.Title: “ideal location, friendly staff, all needs met, contributed to trip enjoyment”
Reviews.Author: mns27
Reviews.Content: Three beautiful, historic canal buildings joined to form hotel, located right on the Singel Canal, the oldest and innermost canal forming the center of Amsterdam. Minutes walk from the central train station connecting to the airport. All city sights walkable from the hotel. Rooms simple and small, but appropriate for a canal house in Amsterdam - adds to the overall experience. Rooms cleaned daily, without pressure from staff to get out of room so they can clean. Important if you're tired from traveling or sightseeing. Staff is very friendly and very helpful., and on duty 24/7. Breakfast is fresh, plentiful. Lots of choices and immediately replenished if running low. Coffee and tea available from staff around the clock. This is a holel you'll want to come back to, and a great bargain considering the location and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “No Problems”
Reviews.Author: LPJR
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a triple room which was clean with comfy beds. Had a view onto the Singel Canal which was nice. Room not very big, but that is a common theme in Amsterdam. Staff were nice and helpful. Continental breakfast was good. Location superb. No issues.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bug Heaven”
Reviews.Author: TRIMOUNTAIN
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel three nights. After the first night, I noticed six bites on my lower back side. I notified the desk and they said that a mosquito must have bitten me. I had left the window open that night, so I let it slide. The second morning brought more bites. I asked them to change the sheets (thinking that would end the problem if it were bedbugs). The third morning I awoke with more bites and a severe, allergic reaction to the bites. I notified the hotel, and again they dismissed my claim. I suffered on the plane trip back home, and I was suffering so greatly that I had to go to the hospital upon my arrival in Boston. They gave me the absolute diagnosis of bedbug bite and allergic reaction. I sent a letter to the hotel so that they could address the infestation, and I got no response. I did not know how to check the room for bedbugs, but now I do. If you do not know how to check, certainly avoid this hotel. It is obvious that they do not check... or care!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable but don't expect any frills”
Reviews.Author: Impagatchi
Reviews.Content: The Singel Hotel is a quirky, conveniently located hotel just 10 minutes walk to Centraal Station. The location is superb, on the canal in a quiet and pretty spot. We had booked last minute on Booking.com and upon arrival we were given a pretty dark and dank double room at the back on the same floor (avoid room no. 8 - it's a dungeon). We actually wanted something nicer so upgraded to a triple with a canal view which was significantly pricier but thought that we wanted something with some light! The room itself was a decent size, with large windows for watching the world go by. The bathroom was a bit tired but was clean enough. The bed was comfy and the sheets and pillows were also clean, so all good. The only downfall was the noise from outside and inside - we could hear people chatting in the hallway late at night and cars rattling past on the window - however, we were well prepared and brought some ear plugs (recommended). Breakfast was a bog standard fare of cold cuts, muesli, eggs and bread. Most mornings they had run out and service was brusque. Overall a decent hotel but I felt that they didn't worry too much about customer service as they would always get enough custom due to its perfect location and charming building. A bit of a shame, but it wasn't dire enough to put us off booking there again.

Reviews.Title: “Small super friendly hotel, ideally located for exploring the sites and canals of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: adajac
Reviews.Content: The Singel hotel is located within 10 minutes easy walking distance of central station and other site seeing attractions, three small canal houses converted into this curious dwelling. Having arrived early we were welcomed at reception with coffee even though the room was not quite ready, an excellent start. Our room was clean, comfortable and compact, overlooking the canal which was an added bonus to observe canal life. Breakfast was good quality buffet style continental, eat as much as you like, from early till late. Bathroom was small, a little tired and in need of upgrade, a process being worked through at present. We felt safe and welcome throughout our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Small Singel Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarn0208
Reviews.Content: Really nice Hotel, friendly staff, very helpful, and clean, gave us a choice of rooms. will be back to the Singel Hotel in the not too distant future.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel ripped me off!”
Reviews.Author: se4dr5
Reviews.Content: I walked into this hotel without a reservation and booked a single room for three nights and paid in advance with cash! I realized the next day I was leaving after two nights, not three (it was the end of a long trip, my bad). When I explained i would only be there for two nights, not three, I didn't get a refund. This was for a slow Monday night ! The hotel kept my money, $140, telling me I didn't give them 48 hours notice. No one with management would talk to me, they even avoided me for the remainder of my stay. Do you think that is fair?

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place”
Reviews.Author: BrusselsMangoKat
Reviews.Content: The Singel Hotel is located in walking distance to most of Amsterdam's major sightseeing attractions and nightlife spots, but thanks to its peaceful location next to the Singel canal, there is no noise whatsoever at night. The hotel itself has a 17th century building, giving the rooms lots of charm but not without a contemporary feeling. Moreover, the rooms are comfortable and spacious - even the single rooms have a rather pleasant size and even something of a view (be it then on a nearby church, and not on the canal). There is free wifi inside the entire hotel, and in the morning, there's a comprehensive breakfast with different sorts of bread and toast, cheese, cold cuts, eggs and muesli. I had a very nice stay and would certainly go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest Single Room in Amsterdam - a fun experience!”
Reviews.Author: Bunnydots
Reviews.Content: I got stuck in Amsterdam for an extra week due to volcanic ash and had to change hotels three times because at that late date it was hard to find a place with availability for a straight week. I had been staying in some higher-priced hotels but by the time I got around to the Singel I was watching my pocketbook a bit so was glad to find a place in the center city that seemed nice for about half as much as I had been paying elsewhere. I also was intrigued by their advertising the "Smallest Single Room in Amsterdam" as I am a fan of creative use of small spaces and really wanted to see how they would make this attic room work, especially given that it had its own bathroom as well! I am a solo traveller and not terribly large or tall, with good flexibility, so I was able to fit myself and my two small bags into the room just fine. It was like a little attic maid's room under the roof slope - very romantic and Sara Crewe-like. There was a bed, a tiny desk and a fairly large (given the space) closet, and that took up just about all the space in the room. It's fine if you're going to be spending most of your time in the room in bed, as I was because I was out sightseeing all day and basically came home to sleep. I would have liked it if the electrical outlets were spaced better - one of them by the door would not hold my US voltage transformer as the door was in the way, and the other was right over the bed which is a fire hazard. Other than that, the bed was comfy, the closet held all of my luggage just fine, and the TV was viewable from my bed. Over the bed was an attic-type window that pushed open allowing lots of fresh air (and unfortunately, the occasional bad smell from a vent on the adjoining roof, fortunately this was only an occasional problem). The bathroom had everything about helf the size it normally would be - a little sink, a little toilet, and a shower in a teeny space. Your knees go under the sink when you sit on the toilet and when you shower, you may find yourself bending over the other conveniences in order to rinse (and everything in the room gets damp/ steamed) but it's way preferable to having to share a bathroom and I was impressed that they were able to fit it all in there. Overall it was a comfortable arrangement for a solo traveller with not much luggage and a sense of adventure. If you don't have good mobility or if you are very tall or fat, or if you need to work in your room, it might not work for you. I did think that the bathroom floor as well as the carpet in the bedroom could have been a little cleaner, especially under the bed (lots of litter under there when I looked) and I was disappointed that the in-room safe was stuck in the "locked" position and would not work at all. The deadbolt lock to my door was also old and sticky and at one point I had a hard time getting it undone. Everything else in the room worked fine. On the other hand, I was absolutely THRILLED that the place had FREE TV including movie channels and some English-language channels, and that it also had FREE WI-FI that worked very well. After paying an extra 24 euros at the last "four star" hotel to have Internet in my room for one day, I was so happy to find a place that wasn't charging for it at all! This is very important to me and I really wasn't expecting the service to be available at a cheaper hotel so I was very happy. Breakfast is mostly cold - meat, cheese (very good), hard boiled eggs, cereal and a variety of bread which you can toast. I was fine with this because I don't like to get up and eat a huge plate of hot breakfast normally. There is a 24-hour snack bar at the reception and the prices for things like a Coke were more reasonable than at other places I stayed. The staff were very nice and helpful throughout my stay and helped me with booking transportation to the airport and printing out a travel voucher. Overall I would consider staying here again, as it was good value for the money, although I would like it if they fixed the safe and un-stuck the deadbolt locks a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Over Priced”
Reviews.Author: craig_warkman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after being stranded due to the volcanic ash. We found it very expensive. When we checked in the girl on reception was great, very friendly and helpful. The room was tiny and dirty. The next morning I was woken up to the sound of staff arguing and this continued at breakfast. The hotel is the perfect location for seeing Amsterdam, but is so highly over priced and certainly not a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for the location”
Reviews.Author: Flump80
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location: right by the canal (and canal cruises!), close to lots of cafes, and only a few minutes walk from the station. If you plan to just use the hotel as a base to explore Amsterdam, then it's ideal and good value given how expensive central Amsterdam hotels can be. The hotel itself is a little dated, but clean. The rooms are quite small - my bathroom was very narrow and may have caused problems for a taller person wanting to use the loo! The breakfast room was lovely, and breakfast itself was limited but nice. Also, free wifi was handy.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for what is offers.”
Reviews.Author: swimmingotta
Reviews.Content: We booked the Singel Hotel after realising that Hotels in this area of Amsterdam were a bit more than we wanted to pay, but we wanted to be in that area. The staff at all times were really welcoming and friendly, and when our credit card had problems at check in (you are asked to pay in FULL at checkin in, which we knew and it shouldn't have been an issue, but there was) they allowed us to stay the first night and pay in the morning once we had the issue with our card sorted. We really appreciated this. The Breakfast room, with the included breakfast, was really nice and what was on offer was really good. They had cold meats, breads and rolls, yoghurts, spreads, boiled eggs and more. Unfortunately that is where the good bits stop. The room was a usual size, but very marked on the walls and carpets and the bathroom had a very unclean feel to it. There was mould on the ceiling, the toilet seat was not fitted properly and the hairdryer must of been the one which was installed in the hotel when it was built. Was this hotel worth the money, no. Would I go back again? Well that is interesting. We bumped into some people we had been on a trip with prior to Amsterdam and were staying in the same area who had paid 60 Euro less than us. They had had a look in our place and said it was much better than theirs, as they had not toaster in their breakfast room. I might stay there again, but after some real thought. They did include free movie channels which we would have had to pay for at other hotels with some 'interesting' channels for free.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: CookingwithMary
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a convenient, mid-town location. The rooms are clean, comfortable and not too small, i(ncludes a full-sized bath tub.) The breakfast, which is included in the room rate, was more than adequate: good variety, quality and quantity. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. This hotel is a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: dchristo
Reviews.Content: Our room was very small, with old and ugly furniture. In the bathroom there was mold, which I find unacceptable for a 3 start hotel in Amsterdam. I understand that this is an old building, but for Godâ€™s shake, just clean the mold!! The stuff was friendly but at the same time very underhanded, trying to take advantage of last minute needs of tourists, which I also find unacceptable for a hotel in Amsterdam. To make a long story short: I will never return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Way overpriced for what it is!!”
Reviews.Author: T0y0ta
Reviews.Content: Arrived to two American tourists having a barney with the receptionist. Complaining about how disappointed they were with the hotel. This filled me with much confidence!! not! I had booked for a double, smoking room, to be told there were no smoking rooms left and instead of a double bed they had pushed two single beds together. There were no apologies for this inconveinience and felt they didn't realy care. The rooms were tiny and stuffy and way overpriced for what they were. I would not use this hotel again and won't be recommending it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “holiday”
Reviews.Author: docemente
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel is located near the central and the staff is very kind.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: happyflyer253
Reviews.Content: Business trips in times of crisis have to be cost-effective! For those who like small and authentic hotels, this is the one to be in. A short 5 minutes walk from the Central Station. All the comfort at an affordable price! The location is on a canal in the old town. Walking distance to lots of nice restaurants and nightlife. The staff truly cares.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here...If you're a Smoker”
Reviews.Author: mspL4
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day break in Amsterdam and opted for the Singel Hotel as a last minute thing as neither of us had stayed there before although we visit Amsterdam every year and have stayed in numerous hotels in Amsterdam over the past 13 years. I booked the Hotel via their own website and, as both my partner and I are smokers, I reserved a Smoking Room as usual. Upon our arrival at the Hotel, the receptionist waited until I'd paid the full amount upfront, (standard practise) before informing us that they couldn't provide us with a Smoking room as we'd requested. I mentioned to the Receptionist that we both smoke and that if we'd known that they couldn't allocate us a Smoking Room we would've stayed elsewhere, (which I'm sure they'd known). The Receptionist responded by saying that Smoking Rooms are allocated on a first come, first served basis so she obviously knew as soon as we'd booked that they wouldn't be able to satisfy our request. The only room they had available which was a smoking room was a triple room for an extra 150 Euros for the use of an ashtray! Of course I had to take the room and pay the additional money much to my dismay but it seemed pointless staying somewhere where we were unable to smoke, especially in March! I raised the issue with another member of Staff the next day and produced my Confirmation Letter, he pointed out that my booking was merely a "Request" and not a confirmation and therefore they didn't have to guarantee a smoking room for us. I told him that we requested a Smoking Room obviously because we both smoke and that it's not convenient for us to have to stand outside in the cold just to smoke. He said that they don't notify guests of whether or not their room requests have been fulfilled prior to arrival but in the 13 times I've stayed in Amsterdam I've never encountered this before. In addition to paying 150 more than what I was expecting, the triple room had 3 single beds in it with 3 single duvets, so my partner and I had to sleep seperately for the whole break. The room had no Fridge or Tea/Coffee making facilities, and the cleaning which was done daily didn't seem to include Hoovering or linen replacement. I would not recommend this Hotel to anyone visiting Amsterdam, there are much nicer Hotels available for the same or less money.

Reviews.Title: “Singel - a very satisfying stay.”
Reviews.Author: FrequentSchlepper
Reviews.Content: We booked a four day stay at this hotel and were very happy with the overall experience. Firstly, the location is great. It is very close to the Centraal Station. In fact, having not known the close proximinity of the hotel, we grabbed a cab and paid a 15-euro flat "zone" rate to ride a distance that later took us about 10 mins to walk. Total rip-off. Plus, the cab driver charged us an additional 2 euro fee per each suitcase. Very surprising. So unless you are traveling with really huge luggage, there's no reason not to stroll down Singel Canal to the hotel. Other than the location, which puts you within easy reach of all public means of transportation and many of the city's key attractions (be sure to take one of the water canal tours - very informative and convinient), the hotel's biggest "pro" was the incredibly pleasant and helpful staff. I travel throughout Europe a lot and this level of service (which we've come to take for granted in U.S.) isn't so common on this continent (complete opposite to Paris' and Brussles' four-star hotels we had visited days earlier). All of the front desk attendees spoke very decent to fluent English and were very accommodating if we had any special requests. There's an elevator (not common). The rooms are very clean and decent size by European standards. The "double" rooms actually have a large size bed rather than two twins pulled together (as you often find in Europe) which creates an uncomfortable devision in the middle of the bed. The furniture was in very good condition and in clean and simple style typical of these northern countries. A large window spanning almost half a wall. Variety of television options in English. My laptop picked up a wireless internet signal, but it wasn't very strong. The breakfast room offers 24-hour access to a computer with high speed internet and my laptop had a nice strong (and free :) wireless signal there as well. After checking into some other options we had considered when booking hotels, I realized that Singel's prices are VERY competitive and the accommodations are quite comfortable with staff that's very pleasant. So I'd highly recommend it and intend to stay there again on my return to Amsterdam. Plenty of shops and restaurants close-by. Breakfast was very good. Everything was very fresh and had nice variety.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, very well located, friendly and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: complimentZeist
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night with my two children. We got a nice triple room with canal view. The kids were very excited about the cosy room for the three of us. The location of this hotel is excellent. Very nearby the Anne Frank house and lots of nice shops and restaurants in the neighbourhood. The room was clean and had everything we needed. Maybe some tea/coffee facilities would have been nice. The bathroom looked a bit old (but clean) but they are very busy renovating it. I have seen one renovated bathroom which looked very nice. The staff was very friendly and helpful in showing me all points of interests on the map. Next morning when having breakfast the children enjoyed their boiled eggs and fresh tea and coffee was served. The variety at the buffet was very good. I promised the kids to return in this hotel for our yearly visit to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, clean hotel, nice location, value for money...”
Reviews.Author: Cranitzki
Reviews.Content: Nice, friendly and multilingual staff. Small hotel, quiet neighbourhood near central station and famous 'nine streets'. Low budget but value for money. Very nice breakfast. Free wifi. Perfect hotel to stay when you 'd like to visit Amsterdam for a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Good for it's Purpose”
Reviews.Author: No1Ma
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 night as a halfway point for my journey. Walking distance to Amsterdam Centraal Station and on the canal. Convenient neighborhood; quiet when I was there. Typical European small hotel - room was small and clean and the prior reviews of the bathroom floor also acting as shower floor are correct. Continental breakfast included in room price was minimal but suitable. Free WiFi internet access was a plus Would recommend hotel as a 1 night stopover, maybe 2 but not for a week.

Reviews.Title: “convenient base for exploring city”
Reviews.Author: IVegas
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for 3 nights. Had room on third floor facing Singel Hotel. Double is actually 2 twins pushed together which tended to separate a little throughout the night (hopefully no one will fall through that crack). Room is heated by radiator and if gets too hot, opened the windows ventilated it quickly during the cold and rainy days we were there. Not much noise from the street and directly across from the Cat Boat. Like the location very much, not expecting 5 star quality nor American chains (Marriott, Hyatt etc) roominess, it costs much less than them also. Thought the value was good and located in a charming canel area. Easy access to many areas by walking (Anne Frank, Dam square, Jordan district, shopping streets, restaurants, red light district, Chinatown etc). Central Station is about 5 minutes walk away to get to airport or take trams around town (did use that to get to Albert Cuypmarket). Amenities other posters have mentioned, staff have been very helpful with maps and suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “Great setting Great Servie Poor Rooms”
Reviews.Author: exeter1
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we had booked a luxury double but when we entered it was so small. We asked for a change and the reception lady was really kind and gave a choice of three. Although these were twins rather than doubles we did get a canal view. The rooms are particularly small and the beds and pillows have seen better days. For 437 euros for three nights we found The Doelen better value. The shower room is particularly small, no window, and a drain in the floor for a shower which is in the same area as the loo and wash basin. Breakfast was provided which was fair and there were free film channels on the TV. The location is excellent and the staff extremely friendly but it does need real redecorating in the rooms and we were disapppointed there were no tea/coffee facilities in room whcih is bad for three star accomodation. Of the rooms available it looked like room 26 was probably the biggest but dont expect a large room. I have to say this is a great setting on the Singel and close to all the Amsterdam shops etc. BUT this is not three star accomodation more like 2! Woudl we go back? It needs a lot doing to it and probably they have tried too hard to accomodate too many rooms in a small space. Given the location I personally would cut the rooms down, make the remainder bigger and go for a slightly higher price. If you want luxury (as stated in the booking) you may need to consider elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great affordable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: taffey68
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights in March. What a great choice. Great value for what you pay, clean rooms, very nice breakfast included with variety of breads, cheese, jams etc. Friendly staff , very helpful with advice on what to do and see. The location is perfect, close walking distance from the train station and in walking distance to all major sights. We only took the streetcar to get to the Van Gough Museum (easy access to the bus and streecar stops). All else is easily walkable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location, On The Canal”
Reviews.Author: painallday
Reviews.Content: The services were great. The Staff is attentive and extremely helpful answered any questions, provided directions, suggestions for dining and helped when there was a small problem on the computer. The rooms were clean and had everything you needed, radio, TV, closets, safe and above all clean full bathrooms. Location was excellent. On the Singel canal, a five minute walk to Central Station, and a host of very good resturants nearby. The Singel provided all the amenties that I need when I travel. Breakfast provided with a variety of choices, coffee anytime you need it or want it, smoking or non-smoking rooms, wine or water or just a chat. Liked the Staff and services they provided, liked the location. The room itself was a bit small, but I didn't dislike it. This was trip was my 60th birthday present to myself and the second hotel in 2 days. Finding The Singel and remaining there for the duration of the trip was the smartest decision made on vacation. Thanks to everyone on the Staff.

Reviews.Title: “Tired loking but friendly hotel in excellent central Amsterdam location”
Reviews.Author: UkGoose
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is well located for easy walking around the Centrum area. Situated on the pretty street of Singel, overlooking the canal, and near the train station. The staff are casual and friendly but professional and service was good. Good breakfast, included in the room price unlike most hotels in the area, with plenty of variety and amounts. We stayed in one of their 4th floor smoking rooms, again not easy to find in most decent hotels. Unfortunately the room itself was disappointing - up in the attic, it was very small with a very basic en-suite shower room which was desperately in need of updating and improving. It was clean, with fresh towels daily but quite off putting in appearance. Generally the room was in need of redecoration and repair. We didn't see the standard of the non-smoking rooms. Despite the room, we had a good stay and the hotel provided a useful base.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Barkerk2610
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights. Room not large, but typical of a capital city 3 star hotel. Great location, very central, on SIngel canal, a few minutes walk from Central Station. Many restaurants nearby and the hotel is near all public transportation. Staff exceptionally helpful and friendly. Only issue was Internet access was very weak and crashed a lot.

Reviews.Title: “great location on the canal,fab for a girly weekend!”
Reviews.Author: bankrupt2
